meanings.definition: To be adjacent or next to something else, typically in a physical sense.
meanings.sent1: The playground is abutting the school building.
meanings.sent2: The two houses abut each other along the fence line.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves abutting the warm radiator during winter.
meanings.sent4: The river abuts the edge of the forest, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of excitement abutting the nervousness made her heart race.

meanings.definition: Touching or bordering upon something else.
meanings.sent1: The abutting walls of the old house showed signs of wear.
meanings.sent2: The abutting properties share a common backyard.
meanings.sent3: The abutting trees cast a lovely shade over the garden.
meanings.sent4: The abutting fields stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The abutting mountains formed a majestic backdrop to the town.
